verses.roman:
piṅgalā nāma veśyāsīd
videha-nagare purā
tasyā me śikṣitaṁ kiñcin
nibodha nṛpa-nandana

synonyms: piṅgalā nāma—of the name Piṅgalā; veśyā—a prostitute; āsīt—there was; videha-nagare—in the city named Videha; purā—in the past; tasyāḥ—from her; me—by me; śikṣitaṁ—what was learned; kiñcit—something; nibodha—now you learn; nṛpa-nandana—O son of kings.
translation: O son of kings, previously in the city of Videha there dwelled a prostitute named Piṅgalā. Now please hear what I have learned from that lady.
